task.title: Setting source highlighting styles

titlealts.searchtitle: Setting source highlighting styles for DTD files

task.shortdesc: If desired, you can change various aspects of how the DTD source code is displayed in the Source view of the DTD editor, such as the colors the tags will be displayed in.

context.p: To set highlighting styles for the DTD code, complete the following steps:

step.cmd: Click WindowPreferences Web and XMLDTD Files Syntax Coloring.

In the Syntax Element list, select the source tag type that you wish to set a highlighting style for. You can also click text in the sample text to specify the source tag type that you wish to set a highlighting style for.
Click the Foreground box and select the color that you want the text of the tag to appear in and click OK.
Click the Background box and select the color that you want to appear behind the tag and click OK.
Select the Bold, Italic, Strikethrough, andUnderline check boxes for additional formatting options.

Click Restore Default to set the highlighting styles back to their default values. If you only want to reset the value for a particular content type, select it in the Content type field, the click the Restore Default button next to it.
Click OK to save your changes.
